text: Python: if string starts with a string from a list
I'm reading a file and each line has a tag, followed by a colon and then the information that I want.
A sample file would look like

code:
Package: com.something.something
Section: Utilities
Name: Something

text:
etc, (It's an apt packages index if you're wondering)
so I want to loop through each line and see if that line starts with an element from a list.

code:
PkgInfo={}
Tags=['Package', 'Section', 'Name']
for line in reader.readlines()
    if line.startswith(element in Tags):
        PkgInfo[element]=line.split(': ')[1]

text: This code doesn't work, but hopefully you understand what I am trying to do.
How would I go about accomplishing this?
